Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.

SupplierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

SupplierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Supplier Reference for the import. Important:For integration systems where we want to limit updates to only a single supplier, this should be a required field and singular and defaulted by the integration system to only be the exact supplier that the user has permission to update pricing. Note that if this is provided, all supplier item updates will need to be for the same supplier.

SupplierObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

SupplierObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Supplier_Item_Price_Update__HV__Data.description: Active Supplier from within Workday. If a supplier is also provided within the supplier item price update header, then this supplier must match the header's supplier.

validation.validation: Supplier for the item does not match the supplier at the header level.

Purchase_ItemObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Supplier_Item_Price_Update__HV__Data.description: Purchase Item ID for the supplier item. In order to uniquely identify the target item, either the Purchase Item ID, Catalog Item ID or Manufacturer Part Number (along with Manufacturer) must be supplied.

Catalog_ItemObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Catalog_ItemObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Catalog_ItemObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Supplier_Item_Price_Update__HV__Data.description: ID for the linked catalog item. In order to uniquely identify the target item, either the Purchase Item ID, Catalog Item ID or Manufacturer Part Number (along with Manufacturer) must be supplied.

Manufacturer Part Number (also know as Manufacturer Part ID or MPN). In order to uniquely identify the target item, either the Purchase Item ID, Catalog Item ID or Manufacturer Part Number (along with Manufacturer) must be supplied. Manufacturer Part Number and Manufacturer are used to identify a Purchase Item. It is valid only for Import Supplier Item. Get Supplier Item will not return any value in this field since a Purchase Item reference is already provided.

ManufacturerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

ManufacturerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

ManufacturerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Supplier_Item_Price_Update__HV__Data.description: Manufacturer. Used in association with Manufacturer Part Number to identify a Purchase Item.It is valid only for Import Supplier Item. Get Supplier Item will not return any value in this field since a Purchase Item reference is already provided.
Item name. Informational only. Any value entered here will be ignored. You can leave blank since this is derived directly from the Purchase Item reference or Catalog Item reference

Supplier item description. Optional. If left blank, the description of the Catalog Item (if present) will be used. If blank and no Catalog Item, the Purchase Item description will be used. Any value set here will override the Purchase Item's description.

Supplier_Contract_AbstractObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Supplier_Contract_AbstractObjectID.type: WID,  Alternate_Supplier_Contract_ID,  Supplier_Contract_Amendment_ID,  Supplier_Contract_History_ID,  Supplier_Contract_ID,  Supplier_Contract_ID_External
Supplier_Contract_AbstractObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
For types that require a parent reference, contains a unique identifier for an instance of a parent object.
For types that require a parent reference, the unique identifier type of a parent object.

Supplier_Contract_AbstractObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Supplier_Item_Price_Update__HV__Data.description: Supplier contracts to be used as default on transactions where item is applied when a contract is not already entered. The contracts in this list should not overlap in date range with each other if they are for the same company, since there can only be a single contract defaulted at a time. Note: for Import Supplier Items, Supplier Contracts are not used and contract specific error validations are skipped if there is a Catalog Item reference. You cannot modify any contract information for a Catalog Item reference using this request.

Item URL. Cannot be changed if there is a linked catalog item. Any value entered in this field will be ignored for Import with a linked catalog item, and the catalog item's URL will be unchanged. For other supplier item without a linked catalog item, the URL can be changed.

CurrencyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Supplier_Item_Price_Update__HV__Data.description: Currency used by the supplier item
Sourcing priority for the supplier item
Lead time for the supplier item

Select to calculate price for Ordering and Just in Time UOMs based on the price entered for the Default Unit of Measure. When advanced pricing applies to a transaction with an undefined UOM, we calculate the price based on the conversion factor of the price rule. This enables you to load 1 price for 1 UOM.

validation.validation: You can't have more than 1 unit of measure for the same price rule when you enable Calculate Price based on Conversion Factor.

Supplier_Item_Price_Update_Unit_of_Measu.description: Conversion factor to the base UOM.

validation.validation: Enter a Conversion Factor when there is a Base Unit of Measure for the Item.

Supplier_Item_Price_Update_Unit_of_Measu.description: Lead time for the UOM of the supplier item.
Indicates whether this Unit of Measure is the default UOM.
Indicates whether the Unit Of Measure is applicable for Just In Time.
Supplier requires this minimum quantity to be met when you order in this unit of measure to avoid penalties. If this is for a Just in Time unit of measure, no minimum quantity is allowed.
Indicates whether the Unit of Measure is inactive.

validation.validation: You can't mark units of measure as Inactive when updating supplier information for the purchase item.
A default Unit of Measure cannot be marked inactive.
Minimum Order Quantity is not allowed for Just In Time Unit of Measure.

Supplier_Item_Advanced_PricingObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Supplier_Item_Advanced_Pricing_Data.description: Supplier specific Advanced Pricing rule being updated.

validation.validation: Advanced Pricing Reference must be for the same supplier and purchase item used for this update.

Supplier_Item_Advanced_Pricing_Data.description: Advanced Pricing rule ID.  This is a unique identifier. For imports, if both Advanced Pricing Reference and Advanced Pricing ID are present, the Advanced Pricing Reference is the one being updated, and ID will be used to replaced the ID value on that rule.

validation.validation: Advanced Pricing ID must be for the same supplier and purchase item used for this update.
This Advanced Pricing ID is already in use. Leave blank, enter a unique ID, or the exact ID used by this Advanced Pricing rule.

Supplier_Item_Advanced_Pricing_Data.description: Start Date for Advanced Pricing. The document date must be on or after this date for the Advanced Pricing rule to apply.

validation.validation: Enter a Start Date.

Supplier_Item_Advanced_Pricing_Data.description: End Date for Advanced Pricing. If present, the document date must be on or before this date for the Advanced Pricing rule to apply.

validation.validation: The Start Date must be less than the End Date.

Select an active Ordering Unit of Measure. This one is either inactive or not defined for this supplier.
Select an active Just In Time Unit of Measure. This one is either inactive or not defined for this supplier.
You can't enter a Ship-To Location when you enter a Multi-Participant type Supplier Contract.
Select a Company, Ship-To Location, Supplier Contract, or End Date before you enter a Unit Price.
You can't have more than 1 unit of measure for the same price rule when you enable Calculate Price based on Conversion Factor.
Enter a currency that matches the currency for the item or the supplier contract. You can leave Currency blank.
You can't enter a Supplier Contract when you enter a Company.
Select an approved Supplier Contract for the supplier that supports manual invoices or manual purchase orders.
For different supplier contracts, create a new price rule. You can't change the Supplier Contract for an existing price rule.

Remove or change the price rule. You can’t have more than 1 active price rule with the same combination of Supplier Contract, Ship-To Location, Company, Just In Time, UOM, and an overlapping date range.

description: Element containing a Supplier Item Price Update data item.Notes on total inactivation or future dated inactivation of Supplier Item pricing: 1. If you want to inactivate a Supplier Item's pricing across all dates, all of its Supplier Item Unit of Measure Data (the pricing related to Unit Of Measure, including historical and future dated) associated with the Supplier Item must be marked Inactive=1 and Default=0 (not a default UOM). One row for each Effective Date, Unit of Measure, and Just In Time=(1 or 0)  combination that exists.2. If you want to inactivate a Supplier Item for a specific date in the future, you must send a Supplier Item Unit of Measure Data for every Unit of Measure used by that Supplier Item, using that same (future) Effective Date and marked Inactive=1 and default=0. If there are Just In Time Units of Measure, additional rows must be sent to inactivate those as well.Similarly, if there is pricing data already saved for the Supplier Item for any other date(s) after that future date, you must send rows for those date(s), inactivating and setting them as non-default.3. You must also mark all of its Advanced Pricing rules for the affected dates (if any) inactive, or else errors will occur.5. If you are not using the supplier item in the future, it is strongly recommended to also set the Sourcing Priority to 0 at that time so the Sourcing Priority number is available for another Supplier.

validation.validation: Enter a Supplier Contract that is approved.
validation.description: This validation is ignored if for a Catalog Item, since any Supplier Contracts entered in payload are ignored.

validation.validation: Enter a Valid and Unique Manufacturer ID for the Purchase Item.
Enter a Manufacturer. Workday requires this when you enter a Manufacturer Part ID.
Select only Supplier Contracts that have a manual invoice or purchase order supplier contract type. Consignment contract types are never valid.
validation.description: This validation is ignored if for a Catalog Item, since any Supplier Contracts entered in payload are ignored.

validation.validation: Select an active Supplier. This one is inactive.
Enter a supplier Catalog Item that is linked to a purchase item. This Catalog Item is not associated with a purchase item.
Catalog Item is associated with another Purchase Item. Enter Purchase Item that belongs to Catalog Item.
Enter a unique Purchase item or Catalog Item or Manufacturer Part ID to update the supplier information.
Update the contracts for this item by removing any which overlap with others. You can't have multiple contracts for the same company with an overlapping date range.
validation.description: This validation is ignored if for a Catalog Item, since any Supplier Contracts entered in payload are ignored.

validation.validation: Enter a Currency.

You can't specify duplicate ordering units of measure.

Select a default ordering unit of measure before you enter other ordering units of measure. The supplier item has active ordering units of measure configured for some dates without a default ordering unit of measure.
Enter supplier contracts that match the supplier for the item.
